groups.name: Things You Find in a Park

easy.notes: Easy category set: 1) Animals by Home groups common pets and animals. 2) Things with Fur highlights animals known for fur. 3) Things with Tails includes animals with tails; note that some items like 'cat' overlap but are placed here for clarity. 4) Park items are familiar playground or outdoor park objects. Near-miss: 'bear' could fit Animals by Home or Things with Fur; clarified by context in this puzzle.

medium.notes: Medium set uses word parts and simple wordplay. 1) Word Fragments: common small morphemes that can start many words. 2) Prefix Pairs: words that start with the same prefix but form different meanings; each item clearly fits its own group. 3) Morning Routines: everyday activities; one-step connection. 4) Shapes in the Sky: familiar sky objects. Near-miss temptation: 'cloud' could be both a weather term and a shape metaphor; it clearly belongs to Shapes in the Sky here.

hard.notes: Hard set uses more abstract groupings. 1) Colorful Materials: differentiate by material and color potential; items span solids and liquids. 2) Habitual Actions: routines connected by daily life rather than objects. 3) Sound Animals: animals named for sounds they make, a multi-step association for some (e.g., 'owl' for hooting). 4) Everyday Objects by Size: grouping by relative size. Near-miss temptation: 'glass' could be a material or a container; here it's kept as a material but note overlap with 'bottle' is avoided by focusing on size category for the group.
